para.dtcname: Software Incompatibility with Body Control Module Not Programmed

content5.ptxt: The forward recognition camera receives vehicle information from the main body ECU (multiplex network body ECU) via CAN communication.
DTC U032251 is stored when the forward recognition camera cannot confirm the vehicle information from the main body ECU (multiplex network body ECU).

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Software Incompatibility with Body Control Module Not Programmed

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: The forward recognition camera cannot confirm the vehicle information from the main body ECU (multiplex network body ECU).

item.ptxt: When replacing the forward recognition camera, always replace it with a new one. If a forward recognition camera which was installed to another vehicle is used, the information stored in the forward recognition camera will not match the information from the vehicle. As a result, a DTC may be stored.

When the forward recognition camera is replaced with a new one, make sure to read Before Starting Adjustment, then perform optical axis alignment for the forward recognition camera and clear the vehicle control history (RoB) for each system.

atten4.ptxt: Forward recognition camera axis alignment can be performed by using either One Time Recognition, Sequential Recognition or Driving Adjustment.

test1.ptxt: Using the GTS, perform a health check.

specitem.ptxt: DTCs are not output by any system other than the front camera system (Front Recognition Camera) and dynamic radar cruise control system (Radar Cruise2).
